Description: Lip, wall and handle sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery kantharos; fine orange clay; ribbed lower wall and crossing ribs under handle; shiny black slip inside and out (much effaced); exterior of lip decorated in the 'West Slope' style with olive garland; inscription cut at bottom of lip on the outside.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 555)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.029)
